author: Mariel Padilla and Jennifer Jett
content:
The international date line serves as the Pacific Oceans dividing marker, so when a hurricane crosses it from east to west, it becomes a typhoon instead, and vice versa.
The same kinds of storms in the Southern Hemisphere are easier to keep straight.

author: nytimes
description: With Tropical Storm Ophelia’s transition to Hurricane Ophelia, 2017 became the first year since 1893 in which 10 Atlantic storms in a row reached hurricane strength.
title: 10 Hurricanes in 10 Weeks: With Ophelia, a 124-Year-Old Record is Matched
